course_title: Topics in Computer Science: Foundations of HCI
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 15 / Seats Avail: 15Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
Prerequisite: CS 253


Department permission required, please email bnflood@emory.edu


This course emphasizes people first and technology second, exploring the
complexity of human beings interacting with technology in a variety of contexts.
Discussion topics include, but are not limited to, different design frameworks, tools and
methods, studies of science & technology (STS), socio-technical systems, AI+HCI,
physical/tangible computing, ubiquitous computing, social computing, augmented and
virtual reality, technology and well-being, intersectional computing, and accessibility.
course_description: May be repeated for credit when topic varies. Pre/co-requisites vary with topic.
